ActionExports.description:
Mapping of variable names to values derived from the action result.
Exported variables are merged into the execution context and become available to subsequent steps.

propertyNames.description: Name of a variable used to store or reference values within a scenario execution context. Variable identifiers must start with a letter and may contain letters, digits, or underscores. Names are restricted to ASCII characters.

ActionExports.title: Exported variables

ActionOutput.description:
Name of the variable under which the action result context will be stored.
The stored value may later be referenced or selectively exported into the execution context.
ActionOutput.title: Result variable

Case.description:
Executable test case definition.

Represents a concrete, executable test case in the DSL.
A case defines its execution context, environment requirements,
optional parameters, and metadata used for reporting and integration.

A case is the primary unit of execution. It may be executed directly
or expanded and orchestrated by higher-level processors.

envs.description:
Definition of environment-based inputs required by the template.
Describes external configuration values, such as environment variables or secrets, that must be provided at execution time.
envs.title: Environment definition

metadata.description: Additional metadata associated with the test case.

propertyNames.description: Name of a variable used to store or reference values within a scenario execution context. Variable identifiers must start with a letter and may contain letters, digits, or underscores. Names are restricted to ASCII characters.

metadata.title: Case metadata

params.description:
Definition of parameters used to drive data-driven execution of the test case.
Parameters define the input space and control combinatorial execution of the case.
params.title: Case parameters

Case.title: Case

CheckTargetValue.description:
Value to be validated by the check.
The value is resolved against the execution context before the check is executed.
CheckTargetValue.title: Target value

ContextVariables.description:
Local context variables provided to block.
These variables are added to the execution context and can be referenced by subsequent steps.

propertyNames.description: Name of a variable used to store or reference values within a scenario execution context. Variable identifiers must start with a letter and may contain letters, digits, or underscores. Names are restricted to ASCII characters.

ContextVariables.title: Local context

DescribedModelDescription.description: Detailed human-readable description of the DSL element.
DescribedModelDescription.title: Description

DescribedModelTitle.description: Short human-readable title of the DSL element.
DescribedModelTitle.title: Title

EnvironmentDefinition.description:
Definition of environment-based input parameters.

Represents inputs expected to be resolved from environment variables
or other external configuration sources.
EnvironmentDefinition.title: EnvironmentDefinition

FileModel.description:
Structured representation of a multipart file field.

This model represents a single file entry suitable for inclusion
in a multipart/form-data request.

content.description: The file content as text or raw bytes.
content.title: File content

filename.description: Optional filename reported in the multipart payload.
filename.title: Filename

mimetype.description: Optional MIME type of the file (e.g., text/plain).
mimetype.title: MIME type

name.description: The multipart form field name for the file.
name.title: Form field name

FileModel.title: FileModel

InputDefaultValue.description:
Default value of the input parameter.
Used when the input is not explicitly provided. Must not be specified for required inputs.
InputDefaultValue.title: Default value

InputDefinition.description:
Definition of a single input parameter.

Describes a named input that can be provided by a user, environment,
or calling scenario. An input may be required or optional, may define
a default value, and can be marked as secret to prevent accidental
exposure in logs, reports, or error messages.
InputDefinition.title: InputDefinition

InputDescription.description: Human-readable description of the input parameter.
InputDescription.title: Input description

InputName.description:
Unique identifier of the input parameter.
Used to reference the input value in expressions, templates, and variable lookups. Must start with a letter and contain only letters, digits, and underscores.
InputName.title: Input name

InputRequiredFlag.description:
Indicates whether the input parameter must be explicitly provided by the user or calling scenario.
Required inputs must not define a default value.
InputRequiredFlag.title: Required flag

InputSecretFlag.description:
Marks the input parameter as sensitive.
Secret inputs are masked in logs, reports, and error messages.
InputSecretFlag.title: Secret flag

InputType.description: Data type of the input parameter.
InputType.title: Input type

Parameter.description:
Parameter definition for data-driven execution.

Describes a single named parameter and its possible values.
Parameters are used to drive combinatorial execution of scenarios
or templates by providing multiple input values.

Each value represents either a concrete value.

values.description: List of possible values for the parameter.
values.title: Parameter values

Parameter.title: Parameter

ParameterName.description:
Identifier of the parameter.
The name is used to reference the parameter value in expressions, templates, and step definitions.
ParameterName.title: Parameter name

ParametersDefinition.description:
Definition of scenario parameters.

Represents inputs expected to be provided explicitly when invoking
a scenario or reusable template.
ParametersDefinition.title: ParametersDefinition

Template.description:
Reusable template definition.

Represents a reusable, non-executable building block of the DSL.
A template defines shared context variables, environment requirements,
and parameter schema that can be reused by executable scenarios.

Templates are not executed directly. Instead, they are invoked or
instantiated by other DSL constructs, contributing validated context,
parameters, and environment data to the execution flow.

envs.description:
Definition of environment-based inputs required by the template.
Describes external configuration values, such as environment variables or secrets, that must be provided at execution time.
envs.title: Environment definition

params.description: Definition of parameters that must or may be provided when the template is invoked. Parameters define the input contract of the template and control its data-driven behavior.
params.title: Parameters definition

Template.title: Template

greaterThan.description: Actual value must be greater than this value.
greaterThan.title: Lower bound

greater_than.description: Actual value must be greater than this value.
greater_than.title: Lower bound

gt.description: Actual value must be greater than this value.
gt.title: Lower bound

greaterThanOrEqual.description: Actual value must be greater than or equal to this value.
greaterThanOrEqual.title: Lower bound (inclusive)

greater_than_or_equal.description: Actual value must be greater than or equal to this value.
greater_than_or_equal.title: Lower bound (inclusive)

gte.description: Actual value must be greater than or equal to this value.
gte.title: Lower bound (inclusive)

lessThan.description: Actual value must be less than this value.
lessThan.title: Upper bound

less_than.description: Actual value must be less than this value.
less_than.title: Upper bound

lt.description: Actual value must be less than this value.
lt.title: Upper bound

lessThanOrEqual.description: Actual value must be less than or equal to this value.
lessThanOrEqual.title: Upper bound (inclusive)

less_than_or_equal.description: Actual value must be less than or equal to this value.
less_than_or_equal.title: Upper bound (inclusive)

lte.description: Actual value must be less than or equal to this value.
lte.title: Upper bound (inclusive)

eq.description: Value that must match the actual result.
eq.title: Expected value

equal.description: Value that must match the actual result.
equal.title: Expected value

match.description: Value that must match the actual result.
match.title: Expected value

partialMatch.description: If true, performs recursive partial matching instead of strict equality comparison.
partialMatch.title: Partial comparison mode

partial_match.description: If true, performs recursive partial matching instead of strict equality comparison.
partial_match.title: Partial comparison mode

ne.description: Value that must not match the actual result.
ne.title: Forbidden value

notEqual.description: Value that must not match the actual result.
notEqual.title: Forbidden value

notMatch.description: Value that must not match the actual result.
notMatch.title: Forbidden value

not_match.description: Value that must not match the actual result.
not_match.title: Forbidden value

partialMatch.description: If true, performs recursive partial matching instead of strict equality comparison.
partialMatch.title: Partial comparison mode

partial_match.description: If true, performs recursive partial matching instead of strict equality comparison.
partial_match.title: Partial comparison mode

expect.description: List of checks that must pass after the action execution. Each check validates some aspect of the action result or side effects. All expectations are evaluated to determine the success or failure of the step.
expect.title: Action expectations

file.description:
Path to a DSL template file to include.
The file must exist, be readable, and contain a valid DSL template definition. The template will be parsed and executed at runtime.
file.title: Template file path

caBundle.description:
SSL verification setting.
Can be a boolean or a path to a CA bundle file.
caBundle.title: SSL verification

data.description: Optional request payload as raw bytes or string.
data.title: Request body

expect.description: List of checks that must pass after the action execution. Each check validates some aspect of the action result or side effects. All expectations are evaluated to determine the success or failure of the step.
expect.title: Action expectations

headers.description: Optional HTTP headers to include in the request.
headers.title: Headers

params.title: Query parameters

query.title: Query parameters

queryParams.description: URL query parameters appended to the request.
queryParams.title: Query parameters

session.description: Logical name of the HTTP session to use.
session.title: Session name
